summary: An internal FBI email dated February 7, 2020, providing an update on the investigation into Ghislaine Maxwell. It discusses interviews conducted in Sweden and with Epstein's pilot, the potential for new charges against Maxwell, and planned next steps including interviews in California and Florida.

persons.name: Maxwell
persons.context: Referred to as the subject of aggressive pursuit by SDNY; the document discusses potential new charges against her and mentions her knowledge that a victim was a minor.

persons.name: Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned in relation to a victim spending time at his properties and the use of his private jet for travel.

connections.description: Maxwell is implicated in the investigation related to Epstein's activities, specifically her knowledge of a minor victim.
The pilot was interviewed and provided information about victim travel on Epstein's private jet.

events.title: Investigation Update Email
events.description: An internal FBI email is sent providing an update on the Maxwell investigation, including interview results and planned next steps.

events.title: Interview in Sweden
events.description: Investigators interviewed a victim's mother in Sweden. While she provided some useful information, she could not confirm a specific trip from Florida to NYC.

events.title: Pilot Interview
events.description: Epstein's pilot was interviewed and confirmed that a victim traveled on Epstein's private jet.

events.title: Expected Plea Offer Submission
events.description: Maxwell's lawyers are expected to submit a possible plea offer to prosecutors.

keyFacts: An interview with a victim's mother in Sweden confirmed the victim spent time at Epstein's properties and that Maxwell knew the victim was a minor.
Epstein's pilot was interviewed and confirmed a victim traveled on Epstein's private jet, contradicting the mother's inability to recall the trip.
SDNY prosecutors were discussing a new, lighter charge against Maxwell: conspiracy to travel to engage in criminal sexual activity, as opposed to the more serious Enticement charge.
Next investigative steps included re-interviewing 'M' in California, interviewing the victim's sister, and interviewing a housekeeper in Florida.
Maxwell's lawyers were expected to submit a possible plea offer the following week.
